{{Infobox disease | Name = Specific developmental disorder | ICD10 = - | ICD9 =
, | }} 'Specific developmental disorders' are disorders in which development is
delayed in one specific area or areas, Ahuja Vyas: Textbook of
Postgraduate Psychiatry (2 Vols.), 2nd ed. 1999 and in which basically all
other areas of development are not affected. http://ww-
w.medterms.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=11249 Specific developmental
disorders are as opposed to pervasive developmental disorders that are characterized by delays in the development of multiple
basic functions including socialization and
communication. http://www.ninds.nih.gov/disorders/pdd/pdd.htm
